[1] Creatinine concentration (the product of creatine breakdown from skeletal muscle) also generally increases after PSE including events such as a half Ironman triathlon, a short triathlon, an ultra-triathlon, a marathon, a 160 km run, and a modified triathlon (28 km canoe, 90 km cycle, and 42.2 run). [2] The increase in plasma creatinine concentration is probably the result of release of creatinine from the working muscles, dehydration, and/or a reduction in renal blood flow and glomerular filtration rate. [1] The transient increase in creatinine and urea after strenuous exercise is thought to be of little clinical concern to renal function.
